data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Can't believe I had never heard of this place before today.  Cute neighborhood location, great pizza, friendly service, and extremely reasonable prices. I have a feeling I just found my new favorite spot for lunch.  We will definitely be back.

data.title: Great Lunch spot, with better prices
data.text:
I went with a girl friend on a lunch date.  It's a ten minute drive from my office, so I counted on having to stay late that night to make up for the time at a restaurant, and I wasn't sure what to expect, because I had assumed it was a bakery.

I got there, parked on the street less than a block away (their parking lot is weird, and I was afraid I'd have trouble getting in and out).  I saw the pizzas on the menu (the pictures are super helpful) and was shocked by the prices!  The mini pizzas start at $2.75 for pepperoni, and go up to $5.00 for the most complex.  You can chose things like carmalized onion, bacon, and smoked gouda (which is what I got and loved) and chicken bruschetta, and more classic options.  Side salads are just $1.25.  They don't even let you tip.

The pizza crust is hand tossed, and is super delicious.  The crust under the toppings is fairly thing, but the edges are airy, soft, and delicious.    I watched him build a different pizza that had artichokes, and the guy was loading it up.  Even at the great prices they don't skimp on the toppings.

I've only been once, and have already told lots of people about it.  I will probably call in an order next week to bring back to the office!  I am curious about the desserts, but I didn't take the time to look.

By the way, I made it back to the office in time, because the service was super fast (and the people were all friendly)!  

YUM!

data.title: Crispy pizza, made with local cheese. AND free coffee!
data.text: Crisp crust, incredibly affordable, variety of toppings (from pepperoni to goat cheese +beet). The cheese is from a local diary farm, and you can taste the difference. Each week they offer a special on one kind of pizza for $2.50. One will fill you, two if you are really hungry. Friendly staff, always make you feel welcome. Grab a cup of coffee (free and good!)- the only downside is that they are open from 10am -2pm Tuesday through Saturday. Can't get enough of this local gem! They also offer soups and have fantastic tortes for dessert. They do have take-out.

data.title: Don't Let The Location Fool You
data.text:
Tasty Pastry is tucked away in a nice little neighborhood and its hours are limited. But don't let that deter you from giving it a try.

Prices are extremely reasonable and there is a solid selection of menu items – particularly pizzas. On the week of my visit, eight-inch pies were on special for $2.50! We chose to sit outside, though inside seating looks equally as inviting. The staff was particularly friendly and went out of its way to make sure I received my food in good order.

data.title: Pizza
data.text: Loved my pizza, very good. Lots of options and they have great desserts too. Not a large space but they have good service and people move through quickly.

data.title: Yummm
data.text:
Tasty pastry is a wonderful friendly restaurant. Mary & her staff always make you feel welcome.  
The soup is always made of fresh ingredients.   The pizza & desserts are to good to describe. We have been going for at least 2 years..enjoying every meal.
A true Omaha gem.

data.title: Comfortable neighborhood spot with delicious home cooked food.
data.text: I have eaten at Tasty Pastry at least 2 dozen times and they never fail to present delicious food cooked perfectly. The soups are made with fresh and healthy ingredients. Their pizzas are baked to order within 10 minutes. There are many options for their personal pies, which are hand tossed. The desserts are positively decadent. The tortes and the carrot cake are the best I've ever had. Mary and her crew are welcoming and efficient. It's quite a crew. I've noticed that the word is getting out about how good they are. I'm happy for them and hope that they don't change anything! Just save a place for us !

data.title: Neighborhood gem
data.text: I hesitate to write a review of Tasty Pastry only for fear too many people will discover this gem! First and foremost, this is a pizza place and the pizzas are perfect. They have a variety of suggested combinations or you can build your own. The crust is pizza perfection – light, thin, crispy. The sauce and all toppings I’ve tried are excellent. Pizzas generally come right out of the oven within 10 minutes of ordering (possibly a tad longer if they’re super busy). The price for single-serving pizzas (starting around $3.50) is extremely competitive. We’ve also sampled several soups and all have been delicious. The pastry desserts are among the very best in town. The flaky torte (apricot and raspberry) is amazing. Dessert prices are also very competitive – around $2.50. The dessert portions can be easily shared by two or more. Very substantial full cakes and tortes can also be purchased for around $15.00. We’ve watched the pastry chef create a raspberry torte (several layers of flaky crust, raspberry jam, and a creamy filling) – the price she charges is a great value given the work she puts in to produce each torte. Most places would charge double, or triple for all of their menu items. The restaurant is a true neighborhood joint. It’s simple, warm, unpretentious and sometimes full of patrons – but that’s the charm. Parking is limited, but never a serious problem. We’ve found the staff members to be friendly and very approachable. The gentleman who typically builds the pizzas is very charming. I only wish they were open 24-hours. Keep in mind they operate from 10-2 Tuesday – Saturday. We are so lucky to have the Tasty Pastry in our neighborhood!

data.title: Wow!! A Wonderful Little Restaurant
data.text: A friend and I had lunch at Tasty Pastry in the middle of the week, and it was a most wonderful surprise.  The restaurant is in a small house on Leavenworth.  There is limited seating in a bright and comfortable space that surrounds the open kitchen area.  You can watch your food being prepared and experience the chatter of a most friendly place.  We each had an individual pizza, but it was hard to choose from among their many offerings, both traditional and unique.  The pizzas were ready in what seemed to be just a few minutes.  They were thin crust, very tasty, and easy to eat.  We also had dessert; I had a sweet bunt cake, and my friend had the carrot cake.  These were equally delicious.  While at the restaurant, we found the people behind the counter to be very friendly, and after our meal, a gentleman came out from behind the counter to ask how we like our food.  He seemed genuinely interested in pleasing us, as did the other workers.  I will return again and again, for the food was so good!!

data.title: Great (and Cheap)
data.text: What a gem. Located is a house near Elmwood Park, this restaurant may be modest, but is also a real treat. The decor is homey, and the space is small (augmented, in good weather, with outdoor tables).  They sell wonderful cakes and pastries, but we came for lunch. The menu is limited--a few soups, a couple of sandwiches, and a plethora of mini pizza choices, including a build your own option. We each had a cup of the bean soup, chock full of veggies and flavor. It, along with a potato soup, are available everyday. There were also carrot/ginger and Italian wedding varieties the day we dined. We then split the veggie pizza, made with great crust, local cheese, and very fresh vegetables. Excellent!  The prices are very reasonable. $12.70 for lunch for two. Very good food and friendly folks.

data.title: Great place for soup and mini pizza
data.text: My sister and I went to Tasty Pastry for a bowl of soup and ended up eating the best individual size pizza.  We ordered the goat cheese and beet pizza:  delicious.  We are going back to try another of the pizzas with interesting toppings.  I think it iwll be the Carmelized onions, Bacon and Gueryre Cheese pizza.  The prices are great; and pick up a dessert on the way out.

data.title: Yum!!!
data.text: Stopped by just to check out the menu at this new spot.  It's located where Come Into My Kitchen used to be.  Sinful pastries that melt in your mouth.  You can't say no to this place--the food is delicious.  Fair warning--they only take cash.   But the prices are great and you won't want to leave empty-handed!

data.title: Best bargain around
data.text: This little gem has short hours of service (10-2 right now) but is my new favorite lunch spot. Everything is homemade and all that I've tried has been delicious (pizza, soups, empanadas, cookies). I'm a huge pizza fan and this place does it right. The pizzas are individual size and the selection of toppings is top-notch. It is also the cheapest lunch around. My husband & I actually felt bad that our lunch cost so little (under $15), particularly since they don't accept tips (you order at the counter). My parents, on the other hand, would've been in heaven. : ) We will be doing our best to keep them in the neighborhood!
